name: RN apps: Share extensions should not list archived channels for sharing content
precondition:
Important

Ensure that `Allow users to view archived channels` is enabled on the server and some public and private archived channels exist
(Setting can be found in System Console under "Users and Teams")

customFields.Priority P1 to P4: P3 - Deep Functions (Do extensive scenarios work?)
customFields.Update notes:
Steve Mudie — Thursday, January 07, 2021 11:09 AM
• Added link to bug reported during RC testing

21 Sep 9 - (LI) - Not able to test share extension in RF

inline.description:
RN share extensions do not list archived channels for sharing content
–––––––––––––––––––––––––
  1. Ensure Allow users to view archived channels is set to "True"
  2. Archive a channel you have access to
  3. Take a photo on your device
  4. Share the photo to Mattermost
  5. Ensure the correct team is selected
inline.expectedResult: • Ensure the channel archived is not listed

customFields.Related ticket(s):
• RN: Archived channels appear in share extension — MM-16078
  • RN share extensions displayed archived channels for sharing content — MM-31737
